p: In terms of its antiviral mechanism of action, after being metabolized to its triphosphate form, ribavirin competes with the physiological nucleoside (adenosine/guanosine) for the RdRp active site [ 124] and is incorporated in the RNA strand, but in some experimental conditions, does not terminate RNA chain elongation, but rather acts as a viral mutagenesis inducing agent [ 125]. The drug is currently used in the treatment of hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection [ 124].
